law_name: New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA)
notes: Major 2024 amendments effective September 3, 2024. Government Records Council provides mediation and investigation. Enhanced privacy protections and litigation restrictions.

basic_request.subject: OPRA Request for Public Records
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA), N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1 et seq., I respectfully request access to the following government records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

[If requesting emails/correspondence, include: discrete time period, specific subject matter, employee names/titles]

REQUIRED CERTIFICATION: I hereby certify that this request is NOT connected to any legal proceeding in which I am a party.

REQUESTOR INFORMATION:
Name: [YOUR NAME]
Address: [YOUR ADDRESS]
Phone: [PHONE NUMBER]
Purpose: [PURPOSE FOR REQUEST]

As required by OPRA, please respond within 7 business days. If any records are denied, please provide written explanation citing specific legal authority.

I understand the first 10 pages are provided at no charge, and any additional pages will be charged at actual cost of duplication.

I prefer to receive responsive records in electronic format when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: GRC Complaint - OPRA Violation
appeal_template.body:
TO THE GOVERNMENT RECORDS COUNCIL:

Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 47:1A-6, I hereby file this complaint alleging a violation of the Open Public Records Act by [AGENCY NAME].

REQUEST DETAILS:
Date of Request: [DATE]
Agency: [AGENCY NAME]
Custodian: [CUSTODIAN NAME]
Records Requested: [DESCRIPTION]

VIOLATION:
The agency [DESCRIBE VIOLATION - failed to respond within 7 business days / improperly denied request / etc.]. This violates N.J.S.A. 47:1A-5.

[If denial] The agency cited [EXEMPTION CLAIMED], but this exemption does not apply because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records are government records subject to disclosure under OPRA.

RELIEF REQUESTED:
I respectfully request the Government Records Council:
1. Find that the agency violated OPRA;
2. Order the agency to provide access to the requested records;
3. Award attorney's fees and costs if the agency unreasonably denied access, acted in bad faith, or knowingly violated OPRA;
4. Impose appropriate penalties for the violation.

I am available for mediation if the GRC believes it would be beneficial.

Alternatively, I may file an action in Superior Court within 45 days of the denial.

Attached: Copy of original request and agency response (if any)

Respectfully submitted,
[YOUR NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[PHONE]
[EMAIL]

Submit to:
Government Records Council
101 South Broad Street, PO Box 819
Trenton, NJ 08625-0819
Email: grc@dca.nj.gov
